oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EVALUATION OF AN OMNIBUS SIDE FOR PASSENGER COMFORT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAUSKAR, DS
DANGE, YK
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The design of an automobile to specific objective like ride comfort is rather a new concept in the Indian engineering environment. The current work has reviewed a systematic approach to evaluate a design of vehicle from the point of view of ride comfort. The application of the technique to the analysis of ride in an omnibus is also shown. The discomfort values at three places in the omnibus are compared. The effect of speed on the discomfort produced by the ride is also studied.
